value: , 49 Hurstmere Rd (next to the NZ Post outlet), phone +64 9 486 8670. Open M-F 8:30AM-5PM, Sa & Su & public holidays 10AM-3PM

From central Auckland drive north on the motorway across the harbour bridge. Take the Northcote off-ramp. Turn right, cross the motorway and follow the signs.

value: content=Sandy beach 1 km long with great views of Rangitoto Island volcano. The Takapuna CBD is at its northern end.
address=cnr Hurstmere Rd and The Promenade
content=North Shore's main performing arts and convention centre.

content=The lake fills a volcanic crater and was originally the main water supply for the North Shore region. It is possible to walk around most of the lake. Some of the shore is private property and detours are needed. The lake is popular for watersports.
content=A theatre and art gallery in a converted water supply pumphouse built in 1906.
content=Along the coast taking you past Takapuna’s ‘Golden Mile’.
content=Takeaway Chinese food. Large servings. Few tables to eat in, but I would not recommend eating in. Most Chinese meals ~$10-$15 (hot food $1+, burgers ~$5, 2/4 per meals packs ~$26/~$49).

content=One minute walk from Takapuna Beach. Offers a Qualmark 4 Star 32-room motel accommodation just a short stroll to Takapuna's shops, restaurants, cafes and nightspots. It is the closest motel to historic Devonport. Whether for business or for pleasure, it is perfectly located for shopping or to escape the hustle and bustle of the city.
